item.title: Libsecp256k1 Maintainers Meeting (2022-10-12)
item.description: Q: Why C89? When I asked you this question a few years ago, I think you said gmaxwell. A: There are a number of embedded devices that only support C89 and it’d be good to support those devices. That was the answer back then at least. Q: Is it a large cost to keep doing C89? A: The only cost is for the context stuff we want to make threadlocal. The CPUid or the x86-specific things.
